tit.e: Narazuke (gourd pickles seasoned in sake lees)
tit.cmt: 説明文を修正しました。
tit.e: Narazuke (gourd pickles seasoned in sake lees)

sen.j: 奈良漬け（奈良漬、ならづけ）とはウリ、キュウリ、スイカ、ショウガなどの野菜を塩漬けにし、何度も新しい酒粕（さけかす）に漬け替えながらできた漬物である。
sen.e: Narazuke is a kind of pickles prepared from vegetables such as gourd, cucumber, watermelon, and ginger which are first pickled in salt, and then pickled in fresh sake lees several times.
Narazuke is a kind of pickles made with vegetables such as gourd, cucumber, watermelon, and ginger first pickled in salt, then in fresh sake lees several times.
Narazuke is a kind of pickles made with vegetables such as gourd, cucumber, watermelon, and ginger first pickled in salt, then in fresh sake lees several times.

sen.j: 奈良漬けは、元々1300年以上も前より『かす漬け』という名で存在していた。
sen.e: Narazuke has been present since more than 1300 years ago and was originally called "kasuzuke".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Narazuke has been present since more than 1300 years ago in the name of "kasuzuke."
sen.cmt: and was originally called "kasuzuke". をin the name of "kasuzuke." に修正しました。
sen.e: Narazuke has been present since more than 1300 years ago in the name of "kasuzuke."

sen.j: 平城京の跡地で発掘された長屋王木簡にも「粕漬瓜」と記された納品伝票らしきものがある。
sen.e: There is something like an invoice that reads "粕漬瓜" even in one of the wood strips of Prince Nagaya excavated at the site of Heijo Palace.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 粕漬瓜：対訳不明
sen.e: There is something like an invoice that reads 'kasuzuke uri' (gourd pickled in sake lees) even in one of the wood strips of Prince Nagaya excavated at the site of Heijo Palace.
sen.cmt: "粕漬瓜" を 'kasuzuke uri' (gourd pickled in sake lees) に修正しました。
sen.e: There is something like an invoice that reads 'kasuzuke uri' (gourd pickled in sake lees) even in one of the wood strips of Prince Nagaya excavated at the site of Heijo Palace.

sen.j: なお当時の酒はどぶろくであったため、粕とは搾り粕ではなく酒の底に溜まる沈殿物のことであったようである。
sen.e: However, as sake at that time was crude home-brewed sake, "kasu" (lees) may not have been strained lees but may have been precipitates that accumulated at the bottom of the sake container.
sen.cmt: どぶろく：crude home-brewed sake （出典：PDIC Ver. 5.0.15) 酒の底→「酒の容器の底」と訳出しました。
sen.e: However, as sake at that time was crude home-brewed sake, "kasu" (lees) may not have been strained lees but may have been precipitates that accumulated at the bottom of the sake container.
However, as sake at that time was crude home-brewed sake, "kasu" (lees) may not have been strained lees but may have been precipitates that accumulated at the bottom of the sake container.

sen.j: また当時は上流階級の保存食・香の物として珍重されていたようである。
sen.e: Also, it seems to have been valued highly as preserved food or "konomono" (pickled vegetables) for the upper class.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 香の物： "konomono" (pickled vegetables) 出典： http://tangorin.com
sen.e: Also, it seems to have been valued highly as preserved food or pickled vegetables for the upper class.
Also, it seems to have been valued highly as preserved food or pickled vegetables for the upper class.

sen.j: 高級食として扱われていたという記録がある。
sen.e: There is a record indicating that it was regarded as luxury foodstuffs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There is a record indicating that it was regarded as luxury foodstuffs.
There is a record indicating that it was regarded as luxury foodstuffs.

sen.j: その後、奈良漬けは江戸時代に入り幕府への献上や奈良を訪れる旅人によって普及した。
sen.e: Thereafter, in the Edo period, narazuke became popular as an item presented to the Bakufu (Japanese feudal government) and also owing to the travelers who visited Nara.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Thereafter, in the Edo period, narazuke became popular as an item presented to the Bakufu (Japanese feudal government) and also owing to the travelers who visited Nara.
Thereafter, in the Edo period, narazuke became popular as an item presented to the Bakufu (Japanese feudal government) and also owing to the travelers who visited Nara.

sen.j: そして庶民に愛されるようになる。
sen.e: And it comes to win the heart of the common people.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 文頭に「そして」を追加し、訳出しました。 訳出時に、時制は原文のまま（現在形）としました。
sen.e: And it comes to win the heart of the common people.
And it comes to win the heart of the common people.

sen.j: そして『奈良漬け』という名前に変わったのは、奈良の漢方医糸屋宗仙が、慶長年間(1596年～1615年)に名付けたからである。
sen.e: And the name was changed to "narazuke" as Itoya SOSEN, a doctor of Chinese medicine, named so during the Keicho era (1596-1615).
And the name was changed to "narazuke" as Sosen ITOYA, a doctor of Chinese medicine, named so during the Keicho era (1596-1615).
sen.cmt: Itoya SOSEN を Sosen ITOYA に修正しました。
sen.e: And the name was changed to "narazuke" as Sosen ITOYA, a doctor of Chinese medicine, named so during the Keicho era (1596-1615).

sen.j: 現在では一般名詞化し、奈良県以外で製造したものも奈良漬けと呼ばれる。
sen.e: At present, the name becomes a general noun, and those that are prepared outside Nara Prefecture are also called "narazuke".
At present, the name becomes a general noun, and those prepared even outside Nara Prefecture are also called "narazuke."
sen.cmt: 後半部を全文修正しました。
sen.e: The name "narazuke" is now used as a general noun, and even those prepared outside Nara Prefecture are called "narazuke."
sen.cmt: The name "narazuke"としました。At present→…is now used

sen.j: ウナギの蒲焼きに奈良漬けの組み合わせは定番となっている。
sen.e: A combination of broiled eel and narazuke is one of the standard dishes.
A combination of broiled eel and narazuke is one of the standard dishes.
A combination of broiled eel and narazuke is one of the standard dishes.

sen.j: 鰻を食べた後に口に残る脂っこさを奈良漬けが拭い去る。
sen.e: Narazuke helps get rid of an oily taste that remains in the mouth when eating broiled eel.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 鰻を食べた後→鰻の蒲焼きを食べた後・・と訳出しました。
sen.e: Narazuke helps get rid of an oily taste that remains in the mouth when eating broiled eel.
Narazuke helps get rid of an oily taste that remains in the mouth when eating broiled eel.

sen.j: そして口をさっぱりとさせる効果がある。
sen.e: And it freshen the mouth effectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 文頭に「そして」を追加し訳出しました。
sen.e: And it freshens the mouth effectively.
sen.cmt: freshen を freshens に修正しました。
sen.e: And it freshens the mouth effectively.

sen.j: 胃の働きを活発にし胸焼けを抑える。
sen.e: It increases gastric activities and prevents heartburn.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It increases gastric activities and prevents heartburn.
It increases gastric activities and prevents heartburn.

sen.j: 栄養面からも脂肪の分解やビタミンやミネラルの吸収を助けるなどの効果があるとされている。
sen.e: From the nutritional viewpoint, It is also said to promote decomposition of fat and absorption of vitamins and minerals effectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: From the nutritional viewpoint, it is also said to promote decomposition of fat and absorption of vitamins and minerals effectively.
sen.cmt: It is を it is に修正しました。
sen.e: From the nutritional viewpoint, it is also said to promote decomposition of fat and absorption of vitamins and minerals effectively.

sen.j: なお、奈良漬けを多量に食べた後に自動車を運転すると、酒気帯び運転となる場合がある。
sen.e: In addition, driving cars after eating a large amount of narazuke may be deemed as drink-driving.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In addition, driving cars after eating a large amount of narazuke may be deemed as driving under the influence of alcohol.
sen.cmt: drink-driving を driving under the influence of alcohol に修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, driving cars after eating a large amount of narazuke may be deemed as driving under the influence of alcohol.

sen.j: だから、食後に運転する予定がある場合は注意する必要がある。
sen.e: Therefore, care needs to be taken in case there is a plan for driving after intake of it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 文頭に「だから」を追加し、訳出しました。
sen.e: Therefore, caution is required if you are going to drive after eating narazuke.
sen.cmt: Therefore, 以外全文修正しました。
sen.e: Therefore, caution is required if you are going to drive after eating narazuke.

sen.j: ただし、アルコール健康医学協会によると、アルコール度数5%の奈良漬けの場合、約60切れ（約400g）もの量を食べなければ基準値に達しないということである。
sen.e: However, according to Health and Medicine of Alcohol Association, the standard level could be reached only after intake of approximately 60 pieces (about 400 grams) of narazuke that contains 5 percent alcohol.
However, according to Health and Medicine of Alcohol Association, it takes approximately 60 pieces (about 400 grams) of narazuke containing 5 percent alcohol in order to attain the reference value.
sen.cmt: 後半部を全文修正しました。
sen.e: However, according to the Health and Medicine of Alcohol Association, it would take approximately 60 narazuke (about 400 grams) with an alcohol content of 5% to reach the legal alcohol limit.
sen.cmt: "基準値"を"the legal alcohol limit"としました。

sen.j: また、財団法人交通事故総合分析センターの実験によると、奈良漬け50gを食べた20分後に行なった走行実験では呼気中のアルコール濃度はゼロであり、走行にも影響を与えていない。
sen.e: Also, according to a study by Institute for Traffic Accident Research and Data Analysis, a driving experiment that was performed at 20 minutes after having 50 grams of narazuke showed breath alcohol content of 0 (zero) and caused no influence on the driving.

Also, according to the experiments conducted by Institute for Traffic Accident Research and Data Analysis, a driving test that was performed at 20 minutes after having 50 grams of narazuke showed breath alcohol content of 0 (zero) and caused no influence on the driving.

Also, according to the experiments conducted by Institute for Traffic Accident Research and Data Analysis, a driving test that was performed at 20 minutes after having 50 grams of narazuke showed breath alcohol content of 0 (zero) and caused no influence on the driving.

sen.j: 酒気帯び運転で逮捕されて当初は「奈良漬けを食べた」と供述した事例でも、後の調べで飲酒していたことが判明している。
sen.e: In those cases in which a driver was arrested on suspicion of drink-driving and made such a statement as "I ate narazuke" at first, the later interrogation has revealed that the driver had taken alcoholic beverages.

There are some cases that a driver who was arrested due to drunk driving made a statement as "I ate narazuke" at first, but the later interrogation has revealed that the driver had taken alcoholic beverages.
sen.cmt: 前半部を全文修正しました。
sen.e: There are some cases that a driver who was arrested due to drunk driving made a statement as "I ate narazuke" at first, but the later interrogation has revealed that the driver had taken alcoholic beverages.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Other
Other
Other

sen.j: 大韓民国でも在日韓国・朝鮮人、戦後の朝鮮・韓国人帰国者が奈良漬けを伝えたことで、一部の人々の間で知られている。
sen.e: Also, in the Republic of Korea, narazuke was shared by Korean residents in Japan and by post-war Korean remigrants and has become common among a part of people.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Narazuke is known among a part of people in the Republic of Korea, since it was brought by Korean residents in Japan and by post-war Korean returnees.
Narazuke is known among a part of people in the Republic of Korea, since it was brought by Korean residents in Japan and by post-war Korean returnees.

sen.j: 市場などでは、そのまま日本語風に”ナラヂュケ”という表音の韓国語で表記されて類似品が売られている。
sen.e: In the market and other places, the similar products are sold with the phonetic expression of the Japanese narazuke (ナラヂュケ) in Korean writing system.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 原文"ナラヂュケ":対訳不明 (原文「そのまま日本語風に”ナラヂュケ”という表音の韓国語で表記されて→次のHPを参考に訳出しました。http://jpn.proz.com/kudoz/english_to_japanese/other/732899-smokedog.html）
sen.e: In the market and other places, the similar products are sold with the phonetic expression of the Japanese narazuke (ナラヂュケ) in Korean writing system.
In the market and other places, the similar products are sold with the phonetic expression of the Japanese narazuke (ナラヂュケ) in Korean writing system.

sen.j: 近年、日本への新しい輸出品目として、韓国の「農水産物流新聞」の主催する市民大学・ビジネスセミナー等で、提案、検討されている。
sen.e: In recent years, as a new export item to Japan, suggestion and discussion have been made in such places and occasions as the citizen's college and business seminars under the auspices of the Korean-based "Newspaper for logistics of agriculture and fisheries".
sen.cmt: 「農水産物流新聞」：対訳不明のため、次の訳を充てました ”newspaper for logistics of agriculture and fisheries"
sen.e: In recent years, as a new export item to Japan, suggestion and discussion have been made in such places and occasions as the citizens' college and business seminars under the auspices of the Korean-based "Newspaper for logistics of agriculture and fisheries."
sen.cmt: citizen's を citizens' に修正しました。ピリオドをコーテーション内に移動しました。
sen.e: In recent years, as a new export item to Japan, suggestion and discussion have been made in such places and occasions as the citizens' college and business seminars under the auspices of the Korean-based "Newspaper for logistics of agriculture and fisheries."
